definition: to imprison/to place under house arrest
remote/hidden away/secluded/serene/peaceful/to imprison/in superstition indicates the underworld/ancient district spanning Liaonang and Hebei provinces

sentences.english: Fair rhea silvia had been shut up in the temple of vesta.
sentences.chinese: 美麗的麗阿？西耳薇婭被幽禁在維斯塔廟裏。

sentences.english: And loosing the pent-up music of overnight.
sentences.chinese: 釋放了整夜被幽禁的音樂。

sentences.english: When Frankie's confinement was over, Frankie's friends gathered by the stable Door.
sentences.chinese: 弗蘭基幽禁期結束時，它的朋友們聚集在馬廄門旁。

sentences.english: Just trapped in castle of dark side of moon.
sentences.chinese: 她們被幽禁在背離月光的黑暗城堡中。

definition: to commit suicide on the orders of a sovereign (old)
to exile/to banish/to deport/to float (logs) downstream
an execution/to put sb to death

to forbid sb to go out/to confine to one location (e.g. student, soldier, prisoner, monk etc)/to ground (as disciplinary measure)/to gate/to curfew/restriction on movement/ban on visiting a place/out of bounds/off limits/caveat
